fields.description: Phenotype or property being measured in the assay
Calcium concentration in bath solution in electrophysiology experiments
Unit of CA_SOL_CONC
Concentration used in an in vitro experiment
Units of value in CONC
Type of assay_test (e.g. (histo)pathology, clinical chemistry, hematology, pharmacokinetics, metabolism)
Experimental method used for obtaining the measurement
Describes the dietary status of the test subjects, e.g. fasted, fed, fed a high-fat meal
Amount of drug administered at one time or the total quantity administered, for in vivo studies. This is 0 in case of control groups.
Record_id for the compound that has been dosed in an in vivo assay. This links to the record_id in the COMPOUND_RECORDS table in ChEMBL.
The compound name of the administered drug in an in vivo assay
Level of the dose administrated within an experiment, i.e. the same compound, vehicle and route (e.g. low, m1, high)
Unit of measurement for DOSE
Dosage form or brand name used (e.g. orally disintegrating tablet, film-coated tablets) e.g. in bioequivalence studies.
Gender of the test subject
Describes the health status of the test subjects, e.g. healthy volunteers, breast cancer patients, arthritis patients etc.
The voltage that the transmembrane potential is held at prior to applying the measurement voltage in electrophysiology experiments
Unit of HOLDING_POTENTIAL
Compound that is co-administered or co-tested with a test substance in a drug-drug interaction assay
Concentration of the co-tested compound in a drug-drug interaction assay (in vitro)
Unit of the co-tested compound concentration in a drug-drug interaction assay (in vitro)
Dose of the co-administered compound (in vivo)
Unit of the co-administered compound dose (in vivo)
The voltage that the transmembrane potential is rapidly stepped during electrophysiology experiments
Unit of MEAS_VOLT
Metabolic conversion of the substrate to the metabolite (e.g. glucuronidation, demethylation)
Number of test subjects in the group
Parameter to which the measurement in the ASSAY_TABS is normalised, e.g. AUC normalised to a certain dose would be 'NORMALISED_BY: Dose'
Value of the parameter in NORMALISED_BY, e.g. 1 in case AUC is normalised to a dose of 1 mg/kg.
Units of value in NORMALISED_TO
Reference ranges for the assay_test provided by the source
Dose regimen (e.g. single, daily repeat)
Course by which the substance was administered in order to reach the site of action in the body (e.g. oral gavage, intravenous)

The time in the study at which the sample is taken relative to when dosing started (in case of multiple-dose studies), e.g. day 15 or month 2, or relative to when the dose was given (ONLY in the case of single-dose studies), e.g. 2 hours. For multiple-dose studies, the SAMPLING_TIME1 is used for recording the time of interim sampling that happens before the end of the STUDY_DOSING_DURATION, e.g. for clinical chemistry or histopathology, or pharmacokinetics. In case examinations are done at the end of the complete dosing period, the SAMPLING_TIME1 will be equal to the STUDY_DOSING_DURATION, and SAMPLING_TIME1 is not a compulsory parameter. For single-dose studies, the SAMPLING_TIME1 can indicate the time between the administration of the dose and when the sample was taken, if applicable, e.g. 12 hours after a single dose blood samples for clinical chemistry were drawn. If a pre-dose measurement is taken, the SAMPLING_TIME1 is negative, e.g. -1 day to indicate the day before dosing.
Unit of SAMPLING_TIME
Source of the data

The doses included in the study as a whole, e.g. 0/100/200/500. Separate multiple doses by '/'. Do not include 0 if there was no control in the study, as in the case of many metabolism and pharmacokinetcs assays.
Unit of the STUDY_DOSES
Length of the dosing period in the study as a whole, not necessarily equal to the dosing duration of the individual sample, e.g. when sampling halfway the study. For sampling time see SAMPLING_TIME.
Unit of STUDY_DOSING_DUR
ID of the experimental study, either provided by the source or created from other ids within the source
Duration of depolarising pulses applied in electrophysiology experiments
Unit of T1_PULSE
Temperature at which the experiment was conducted
Unit of TEMP
Record_id for the compound that has been tested in an in vitro assay. May be corresponding to CONC. The record_id links to the record_id in the COMPOUND_RECORDS table in ChEMBL.
Compound name in supplied sdf/compound_tabs file for the compound that has been tested in an in vitro assay. May be corresponding to CONC.
Interval of time over which a course of doses occurs, or sacrifice time (DrugMatrix and TG-GATES respectively)
Unit of measurement for TIME
Carrier or inert medium used as a solvent (or diluent) in which a medicinally active agent is formulated and/or administered
